item.title: Reticulate!
item.description: Python and R Working Together Reticulate is a really cool function that allows us to use two coding languages at the same time! In this blog post, we'll see how R and python can be used simultaneously for different functions. library(reticulate) library(ggplot2) library(ggExtra) For example, I have the iris dataset imported into python here: import seaborn as sns df= sns.load_dataset('iris') However, if I only like to make graphs using ggplot in R, then I can save the iris dataset (abbreviated to df) into R.
